results.title: Solving the problem
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The final step in the process of performance appraisal is reaching a solution relevant to the problem and its cause which involves considering realistic options, agreeing on a clear action plan and setting a review date to ensure the plan is working.

results.title: Breaking in children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Behaviour therapy although popular in the US as a method of treating difficult children is usually regarded by British authorities as fit only for animal training. This program looks at a therapist in Belfast working with two uncontrollable children and their mothers in an obey-reward, non compliance-punishment regime.

results.title: Brave new babies?
results.creator_credit: Oliver Morse, David Dugan and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Introduces some of the new developments in genetic engineering including gene mapping, cloning and embryo manipulation. Argues that we should sort out our attitude to genetic engineering now before biology catches up with science fiction.

results.title: The Fast Track
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, Ken Chown, Granada International Productions and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
The Minister for Enterprise has a pet Bicentennial project: he wants to build the fastest train in the world, to service marginal electorates on its run from Sydney to Canberra. Businessmen and lobbyists share his enthusiasm for the supertrain but his Department head has reservations which the Press and the Parliamentary Opposition are keen to exploit! Moderator: Geoffrey Robertson.

results.title: Benjamin
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Robin Bates and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
This is the story of the first six months of the life of Benjamin Pile, whose entry into the world on November 22, 1974 was filmed by a ‘Horizon’ team, who then recorded his growth and development in the weeks that followed.

results.title: Phil's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Phil works in despatch. Complaints about mistakes and late deliveries prompted his supervisor Kris to talk with him attempting to resolve the problem. Peter Quarry then assumes the role of supervisor using the three step approach.
results.description:

results.title: Behind the horoscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Modern science rejects astrology as superstition but despite this it thrives. The film takes a look at the history of astrology and its modern practice, interviewing both scientists and astrologers.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Modern science rejects astrology as superstition but despite this it thrives. The film takes a look at the history of astrology and its modern practice, interviewing both scientists and astrologers.

results.title: The Ape that stood up
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the evolution of man, and his split from the apes to the development of modern man. Shows archaeological discoveries which helped to revise our ideas about the human line of descent. Includes research done by Lewis & Mary Leakey. No other credits available.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the evolution of man, and his split from the apes to the development of modern man. Shows archaeological discoveries which helped to revise our ideas about the human line of descent. Includes research done by Lewis & Mary Leakey. No other credits available.
description_for_label:

Traces the evolution of man, and his split from the apes to the development of modern man. Shows archaeological discoveries which helped to revise our ideas about the human line of descent. Includes research done by Lewis & Mary Leakey. No other credits available.

results.title: In pursuit of the possible
results.creator_credit: Ian Host, Alistair Innes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
Moderated by Geoffrey Robertson, this program examines, by means of hypothetical situations, the role that Australia can play in meeting the challenges posed by disarmament and arms control. The program has been divided into three parts to facilitate its use by community and educational groups and to permit discussion of the various issues as they arise.

results.title: Does Dracula have Aids?
results.creator_credit: John Lander, Ken Chown and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
AIDS is the most publicised and least understood disease in Australia. This video may help to clear up some of the confusion as the discoverer of the AIDS virus, Professor Luc Montagnier, joins Australia’s most experienced AIDS specialists and community leaders to confront the ethical and social dilemmas created by the disease. Geoffrey Robertson’s Hypothetical on AIDS was filmed on 12th August, 1986.
